posts.post_content:
The reason I rate this card as a 5/5 is because it can singlehandedly screw up 2 forms of first turn kills.  
One of those is the [Protean Hulk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Protean Hulk) "turn 0" klll, which doesn't have to be turn 0 at all.  
The other one is one which I have personally felt: the [Animate Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animate Dead) + [Buried Alive](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Buried Alive) (allowed on the first turn by a pair of rituals or some other acceleration) that searches for a [Worldgorger Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worldgorger Dragon) and some other creature that would kill the opponent instantly if given infinite black mana (such as [Oona](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oona))  
  
Decks that can kill on the turn 1 are the most dangerous there is, so a card that can stop them cold get to be 5/5 (see also, [Leyline of Sanctity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Sanctity))
posts.html:
The reason I rate this card as a 5/5 is because it can singlehandedly screw up 2 forms of first turn kills.

The other one is one which I have personally felt: the Animate Dead + Buried Alive (allowed on the first turn by a pair of rituals or some other acceleration) that searches for a Worldgorger Dragon and some other creature that would kill the opponent instantly if given infinite black mana (such as Oona)

Decks that can kill on the turn 1 are the most dangerous there is, so a card that can stop them cold get to be 5/5 (see also, Leyline of Sanctity)

Posted By: Arthindole (7/9/2010 10:39:07 AM)

posts.post_content:
Actually this isn't only way to kill an Emrakul. Read Emmy's text: When Emrakul of the Aeons Torn is put into the graveyard...
  
   
You can sac a [Nihil Spellbomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nihil Spellbomb) in response to his graveyard trigger and exile him.
  
   
This just happened in an EDH game the other night. The guy casting Emrakul looked at it, then looked at the spellbomb,pulled the spellbomb out of its sleeve, ripped it in half, and replaced it.
  
   
Ironic because this is the guy who casts [End the Turn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=End the Turn) to counter other people's Emrakuls.
  
   
   
   
Completely unrelated, Opera spellcheck says Nihil isn't a word. In its place it suggests other nihil related words along with Nichol and Unholy. O\_o
posts.html:
Actually this isn't only way to kill an Emrakul. Read Emmy's text: When Emrakul of the Aeons Torn is put into the graveyard...

This just happened in an EDH game the other night. The guy casting Emrakul looked at it, then looked at the spellbomb,pulled the spellbomb out of its sleeve, ripped it in half, and replaced it.

Ironic because this is the guy who casts End the Turn to counter other people's Emrakuls.



Completely unrelated, Opera spellcheck says Nihil isn't a word. In its place it suggests other nihil related words along with Nichol and Unholy. O_o
